required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase I Study of KC1036 in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I, Open-label, Dose Escalation Study Evaluating the Safety, Pharmacokinetics and Preliminary Efficacy of KC1036 in the Patients With Advanced Recurrent or Metastatic Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety，tolerability, pharmacokinetics, and preliminary efficacy of KC1036 in participants with advanced recurrent or metastatic solid tumors. The trial will be divided into three parts: dose-escalation phase, dose-expansion phase, RP2D-extension phase.

primary_outcome.time_frame: First 4 weeks after initial administration of KC1036
primary_outcome.description: MTD will be defined as the maximum dose level at which no more than 1 of 3 participants experience a dose-limiting toxicity (DLT) within the first 4 weeks of multiple dosing.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment up to 30 days after last dose

secondary_outcome.time_frame: First 4 weeks after initial administration of KC1036
First 4 weeks after initial administration of KC1036
secondary_outcome.description: Time to reach the maximum plasma concentration

secondary_outcome.time_frame: First 4 weeks after initial administration of KC1036
First 4 weeks after initial administration of KC1036
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the single-dose plasma concentration-time curve from Hour 0 to the last quantifiable measurable plasma concentration, or Area under the single-dose plasma concentration-time curve from Hour 0 to infinity

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 6 weeks for the duration of study participation; estimated to be 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Overall response rate (ORR) was defined as the percentage of participants with a best overall complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) per RECIST 1.1.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 6 weeks for the duration of study participation; estimated to be 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Progression-free survival (PFS) was defined as the time from the start date of study drug to the date of the first radiologically documented progressive disease (PD) per RECIST 1.1 or death due to any cause.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 6 weeks for the duration of study participation; estimated to be 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Disease Control Rate (DCR) was defined as the percentage of participants with a best overall complete response (CR), partial response (PR), or stable disease (SD) per RECIST 1.1.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 6 weeks for the duration of study participation; estimated to be 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of response (DOR) was defined as the time from first documented response (partial response (PR) or complete response (CR)) to the date of first documented disease progression (PD) or death due to any cause, among patients with a confirmed PR or CR per RECIST 1.1.

arm_group.description: Patients take a single dose of KC1036 for the pharmacokinetic study, then off for 5 days before the first cycle begins. In the subsequent treatment cycles, KC1036 are given orally once daily, 21 days as a cycle.

intervention.description: Part 1: Dose-escalation phase , KC1036 10mg~80mg, consists of 5 Cohorts. Part 2: Dose-expansion phase, consists of 2~3 Cohorts based on part 1. Part 3:RP2D-extension phase, Recommended dose of KC1036 based on part 1and part 2.
